summary: This is an FBI 302 form documenting an interview with a female victim (referred to as 'Victim-1' or 'Jane Doe') conducted on September 18, 2019. The victim describes meeting Jeffrey Epstein through her sister at age 15, traveling to his properties in New York, Las Vegas, and New Mexico, and experiencing inappropriate and sexually suggestive behavior from Epstein. The document details financial support for college, the presence of Ghislaine Maxwell, and various incidents at Epstein's New Mexico ranch.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure accused of orchestrating travel and engaging in sexually suggestive behavior with the minor victim. He paid for her college and invited her to his properties.

persons.name: Gloria Allred
persons.context: Present as an attorney during the FBI interview of the victim.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Arrived at the New Mexico ranch via helicopter. Described as initially nice but becoming mean after her dog drowned. Epstein stated he used to date her.

persons.name: David Copperfield
persons.context: The victim was invited to his show in Las Vegas by Epstein's secretary, and the group received a backstage tour where Epstein was present.

persons.name: Bill Clinton
persons.context: Epstein asked the victim if her parents voted for him during the plane ride to New Mexico.

connections.description: Epstein told the victim he used to date Maxwell. Maxwell was present at his New Mexico ranch.
The victim's sister was staying at Epstein's house and was the connection through which the victim met Epstein.
Epstein arranged for the victim and others to attend a David Copperfield show and receive a backstage tour.

events.title: Victim's High School Years and Initial Contact
events.description: The victim, aged 14-18, lived in Michigan. At age 15, she met Epstein through her sister during a school trip to New York City.

events.title: Trip to Las Vegas and New Mexico Ranch
events.description: At age 15, the victim traveled to Las Vegas for a David Copperfield show and then to Epstein's ranch in New Mexico via his private plane. During the flight, Epstein made inappropriate comments.

events.title: Incidents at New Mexico Ranch
events.description: Over 3-4 days, the victim experienced multiple inappropriate incidents: Epstein commented on hot tub jets; a photographer gave her an unwanted massage; Epstein took her to his bedroom for a massage; he took photos of her in lingerie; and he conducted breathing exercises with her at his feet.

events.title: Financial Support for College
events.description: Epstein wrote the victim a $5,000 check to pay for her college tuition after she expressed her desire to attend college.

events.title: Victim Sees Epstein on TV
events.description: The victim saw Epstein on television while she was in rehab.

events.title: FBI Interview of Victim
events.description: The victim was interviewed by the FBI, with AUSAs, a detective, a special agent, and attorney Gloria Allred present.

locations: New York City, New York (Epstein's mansion)
keyFacts: The victim was 15 years old when first contacted by Epstein's secretary and invited to travel.
Epstein's secretary played a key role in arranging travel, gathering contact information, and facilitating initial contact between Epstein and the victim.

During a trip to Epstein's New Mexico ranch, the victim was subjected to multiple sexually suggestive situations, including being photographed in lingerie, giving Epstein a massage in his bedroom, and being told about the hot tub jets' alleged purpose.
Epstein provided the victim with financial support, including a $5,000 check for college tuition.
Ghislaine Maxwell was present at the ranch, and her demeanor changed after her dog drowned in a fountain.
